Literature Review: Hybrid quantum mechanical/molecular mechanical (QM/MM) methods have revolutionized the field of biomolecular research by providing a powerful tool for studying complex energy transduction processes in biomolecular machines. These methods combine the strengths of quantum mechanics (QM) and molecular mechanics (MM) to simulate the behavior of biomolecules at the atomic level. In this review, we will discuss the basic methodological details of QM/MM approaches, their applications to various energy transduction problems, and the importance of balancing computational efficiency and accuracy.
